title: Part. motion, given v(t) and x(0) part - c

content.description: For 0 ≤ t ≤ 12 , a particle moves along the x-axis. The velocity of the particle at time t is given by v(t) = cos(π/6t) . The particle is at position x = -2 at time t = 0.
content.question: Find the acceleration of the particle at time t. Is the speed of the particle increasing, decreasing, or neither at time t = 4? Explain your reasoning.

frqParts.text: Find the acceleration of the particle at time t. Is the speed of the particle increasing, decreasing, or neither at time t = 4? Explain your reasoning.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
